isis.stitle: 530 and DT-466/408 Diesel Engine Service (1994) - FUEL INJECTION PUMP - FUEL INJECTION PUMP

svcproc.title: GENERAL REMOVAL PROCEDURES

important.para: CLEANLINESS IS OF UTMOST IMPORTANCE WHEN SERVICING FUEL INJECTION SYSTEMS. ALWAYS CLEAN ENGINE BEFORE INJECTION PUMP IS REMOVED OR DISCONNECTING FUEL LINES. ALWAYS PLUG OR CAP ANY OPENING TO PREVENT DIRT, PAINT CHIPS OR OTHER FOREIGN MATERIAL FROM ENTERING THE FUEL SYSTEM. DO NOT CLEAN WITH ENGINE RUNNING.

svcproc.para: Set injection pump to engine timing prior to pump removal as follows:

step1.para: Disconnect accelerator cable or linkage from outer injection pump control lever.
Remove injection pump gear drive access cover from front of engine.

warning.para: Shut-off must be in no-fuel position before proceeding.

step1.para: Rotate the engine in the normal operating direction until the engine front cover timing pointer is on the degree mark on the damper pulley for the particular application.

Verify that small hole in drive gear aligns with lock plate hole behind hub. If aligned, the #1 piston is on the compression stroke. Refer to Figure 11.6
.

note.para: The above procedure establishes the accuracy of the previous timing and avoids the necessity of removing the valve cover to establish the #1 compression stroke during reassembly.
